full_text: I have two requirements that I need to implement. The first requirement is that adjusters should not be able to approve a single payment more than $5,000. I'll navigate to the authority limit page, under administration. And click the adjuster profile. I see that, while the adjuster cannot approve the payment, the amount of total payments greater than $15,000. There is no limit on specific payments. This means that an adjuster can approve a single payment for $15,000. This is not the desired behavior, so I click Edit. I add a new authority limit. The type of the authority limit is payment amount. And the amount is $5,000. I click Update to confirm the change. The second requirement is $5,000. I click Update to confirm the change. The second requirement is $5,000. I click Update to confirm the change. The second requirement is to restrict the change. The requirement is to restrict the authority of one adjuster. Chris Craft is under investigation for possibly issuing false payments. Therefore, we do not want Chris to issue any payments without a supervisor's approval until the investigation is completed. To accomplish this, I will give Chris a custom profile. The current profile is almost correct. The current profile is almost correct. The only change I need to make is to the payment amount, which must be zero. When the investigation is completed, if it turns out that Chris is innocent, I can return and restore the standard adjuster authority limit. Now, to test the work I've done. I'll log in as an adjuster. And navigate to a claim. Looking at the financials for the claim. I can see that Exposure Number 4 has reserves greater than $5,000 that have not been paid out yet. I'll create a payment on that reserve line. The payee is Bo Simpson. This will be a partial payment in the amount of $6,000. When I click Finish. I can see that the status of the payment is pending approval. And when I look at the work plan. I can see to whom the approval activity has been assigned. Now, to test the custom profile that I created. I log in as Chris Craft. I'll navigate to the same claim as before. I'll create a check in the amount of $10. The payee is Bo Simpson. And I'll use the same reserve line as before. This will be a partial payment in the amount of $10 for mileage. I'll quickly finish the check. And I see that even this tiny payment is pending approval. This is the end of the Authority Limits demonstration.

segments.text: I have two requirements that I need to implement. The first requirement is that adjusters should not be able to approve a single payment more than $5,000. I'll navigate to the authority limit page, under administration. And click the adjuster profile. I see that, while the adjuster cannot approve the payment,

the amount of total payments greater than $15,000. There is no limit on specific payments. This means that an adjuster can approve a single payment for $15,000. This is not the desired behavior, so I click Edit. I add a new authority limit. The type of the authority limit is payment amount. And the amount is $5,000. I click Update to confirm the change. The second requirement is $5,000. I click Update to confirm the change. The second requirement is $5,000. I click Update to confirm the change.

The second requirement is to restrict the change. The requirement is to restrict the authority of one adjuster. Chris Craft is under investigation for possibly issuing false payments. Therefore, we do not want Chris to issue any payments without a supervisor's approval until the investigation is completed. To accomplish this, I will give Chris a custom profile.
The current profile is almost correct. The current profile is almost correct. The only change I need to make is to the payment amount, which must be zero.
When the investigation is completed, if it turns out that Chris is innocent, I can return and restore the standard adjuster authority limit. Now, to test the work I've done.
I'll log in as an adjuster.
And navigate to a claim. Looking at the financials for the claim.
I can see that Exposure Number 4 has reserves greater than $5,000 that have not been paid out yet. I'll create a payment on that reserve line.
The payee is Bo Simpson.
This will be a partial payment in the amount of $6,000.
When I click Finish.
I can see that the status of the payment is pending approval.
And when I look at the work plan.
I can see to whom the approval activity has been assigned.
Now, to test the custom profile that I created.
I log in as Chris Craft.
I'll navigate to the same claim as before.
I'll create a check in the amount of $10.
The payee is Bo Simpson.
And I'll use the same reserve line as before.
This will be a partial payment in the amount of $10 for mileage.
I'll quickly finish the check.
And I see that even this tiny payment is pending approval.
This is the end of the Authority Limits demonstration.
